name: Hotel Chandler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hotel Chandler is a friendly, reasonably priced boutique hotel. Some of the reviews here mention how small the rooms are, how far the hotel was from any subway station and how the traffic noise was distracting. I'd like to say that hotel rooms in Manhattan are small by comparison and our room at this hotel was adequate in size. The nearest subway is only two blocks away, any closer and the trains will keep you up all night. I didn't hear any traffic noise and frequently slept in undisturbed by the morning rush hour.
reviews.title: You'd be hard pressed to find better value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: This hotel is excellently situated; only two blocks from the Empire State, a short walk from the Flatiron district, Chelsea, Time Square, Macy's. The hotel boasts free WiFi, air conditioning, a gym, free morning coffee and New York Times and a friendly bar on site for early or late evening drinks. With several breakfast cafes only a short walk away and Anthony Bourdain's excellent Les Halles Brasserie only two blocks east on Park Avenue, you won't have far to go for something to eat.
reviews.title: Good Spot in Murray Hill

likes.liked: — The location, the room size, and the room rate.
likes.disliked: — It was hard to get the room to be the right temperature.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To sum up: the rooms are spotless, the beds comfy, the staff friendly and helpful and the location A1 and you'd be hard pressed to find better value.
reviews.title: tiny room, great amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Given the high prices of hotels in New York City, the Hotel Chandler is a welcome alternative. It’s centrally located. The staff was responsive and courteous. My room was a decent size. And the cost was affordable. The elevators were a little slow, but since my room was on the fourth floor, taking the stairs was a breeze. Definitely plan to stay here again!
reviews.title: Best Hotel! Best Price!! We got a steal!!

likes.liked: — The location, the clean and beautiful modern decor of our room.
likes.disliked: — Nothing!! Hands down this place was great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just spent one night at Hotel Chandler this past weekend.
reviews.title: A treasure!

likes.liked: — It was quiet and in a real neighborhood, not tourist central.
likes.disliked: — Can't think of a thing! I was so pleasantly surprised!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for five nights and could not have been happier with the experience! First of all Hotel Chandler is in a great location... extremely convenient to all of the neighborhoods we visited. We were only a couple of blocks from the nearest subway which made getting around very easy! The people at the hotel were great! Very unobtrusive when necessary, and extremely helpful when needed. For example, our first night there we had just arrived in New York and were tired and hungry. We wanted to find a nice restaurant right by the hotel. Not only did they help us find a great place but also provided us with a full listing of restaurants in the immediate area. We were also able to get directions to different places from them and once when we forgot an address for a place in our room we called the hotel and they provided us with the info! Extremely helpful! Yes our room was small but beautifully appointed. Loved the coziness and color scheme and the bathroom was just adorable with all of the blue and white tiles! We love boutique style hotels and would definitely stay there again on our next visit to New York.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel Chandler!

likes.liked: — great location and boutique style hotel

reviews.title: Definitely for the budget conscious!
reviews.text: I stayed for a weekend in late June. The location was prime, right off of 5th ave and walking distance to the subways. However, the rooms were TINY, even by NYC standards. The decor was nice and the rooms were certainly clean. Just be forewarned about slamming doors heard whenever someone leaves their room on the floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I just returned from a three night stay at the Chandler.
reviews.title: Loved the Chandler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have long been going to NYC and have stayed at many hotels in the area , being most loyal to a hotel on 51st Street until this trip when I decided to broaden my horizons and try something new and different. I'm really glad I did...
reviews.title: No complaints, but a few hints...

likes.disliked: — Not conviently located for my personal needs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I really enjoyed this boutique hotel. The front desk staff and the doorman were exceptionally friendly and helpful from check in to check out. The room was nicely decorated and the linens, duvet and cherry wood furniture were an added bonus. I did not use the in room bar nor the snacks ( That would be crazy $$ )
reviews.title: Charming hotel

likes.liked: — Very nice room, clean, good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived at Hotel Chanlder we knew it was going to be a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: The perfect NYC base!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival - upon arrival we were greeted by the reception staff, who were able to quickly allocate our rooms and point us in the right direction. Unfortunately, our bags had been left in LAX by the airline - they were later delivered to the hotel and promptly taken to our rooms.
reviews.title: Perfect location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Location - We soon realised the location was excellent. A few blocks in any direction and you could find anything you were looking for (food, shopping, transport, sights etc). Cabs were plentiful and hotel staff were always keen to help flag one down.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, and the location is great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Staff - More than helpful in every way. The front desk staff were always willing to offer advice, but the concierge/doormen and 'Sammy' in the bar deserve special mention. Sammy - good luck on your upcoming trip home to see your family, and thanks for the drinks! One evening we were very keen for a very good steak - the reception offered a list of nearby restaurants and suggested Primehouse... an excellent suggestion and much enjoyed.
reviews.title: Great hotel for many reasons...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel really did set up up for a great stay in NYC and I can not offer enough praise. Welld one, we will be back!
reviews.title: Great Location and Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I come to New York a few times a year to see a show or visit friends and we usually Priceline a hotel or find a special rate since I hate to pay over $200 a night. This time we tried Hotwire and wound up with the Chandler as our hotel (I believe we typed in Empire State Bldg area and 4 stars). I hadn't stayed here before but am very familiar with the neighborhood so I was pleased to see the location, knowing we could walk from Penn Station. The hotel had a nice art deco kind of style and the rooms were obviously updated. Although the bed took up almost the entire room, the room was spotlessly clean and I liked the modern decor. The bathroom was fairly large at least. We really only go to the hotel to sleep, so the size really was irrelevant to me but if I was staying there for a week on vacation I'm sure it would be annoying. The hotel was very quiet and we had no issues whatsoever. Very pleasant stay, I'd definitely come back.
reviews.title: Great night at the Chandler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at 1.30pm after a long flight and hoped to get into our room,unfortunately we had to wait till 3.00pm to get into our room.The room was comfortable but quite small.The bathroom was tiny and while it had a large walkin shower which was good the tap to turn the shower on was at the far end so you had to stand atb the far end ,turn on the water and wait till it got warm.The free wifi was good and the hotel is in a great location with everything you need at the end of the street.Overall a decent place to stay.
reviews.title: Decent stay,good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: Everything about this hotel was perfect. Location was close enough to all the Times Square attractions yet away from the crowds. The rooms were clean and suprisingly roomy, for New York standards. The best part was the reasonable price. This may sound like a canned review, but I really like this Hotel. I will stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My first trip to NY and couldn't have picked a better hotel. It was clean, the staff excellent, modern and provided all the amenities you would need. The empire state was just around the corner about 1 minutes walk and Times Square, Macy's, Fifth Avenue, Central station etc all within a few minutes walk. It was on a quiet street so away from crowds of tourists and traffic noise.
reviews.title: Fab Hotel - Fab Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: When we asked about restaurants they even have a list separated into price ranges for you to chose from which was very handy. The bar also has a happy hour from 4pm-10pm which was good for pre-outing drinks.
reviews.title: Great service and great room = happy guests!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I took a a group of 26 Executive MBA students to NYC and we stayed at Hotel Chandler. We were all very happy to have stayed there. The staff has been very helpful,friendly and professional at the same time. The location is also great. I would definitely stay there again if I go back to NYC, whether on a business trip or for leisure. The only thing that I would like to propose for an improvement is the air conditioning which is a little bit noisy.
reviews.title: VERY WELCOMING STAFF AND EXCELLENT LOCATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel Chandler is very convenient to subways and within walking distance to many major attractions; the staff is polite and attentive. The linens and towels are very good quality and the king sized bed is comfortable however it takes up most of the room. The furniture has sufficient space to hang or store clothes for two people. The noise level at night is reasonable for mid town Manhattan. The bathroom is a bit small but very clean with up to date fixtures. Room lighting is a little on the dim side. Turn down service with chocolates is a nice touch. If you did not go for the prepaid breakfast package skip the “continental” breakfast, it’s $40 for two; go around the corner and get twice the breakfast for a third of the price. For good pizza within walking distance go around the corner to 31st and Madison. Overall for the money the hotel Chandler is great place to stay, would stay here again.
reviews.title: Our first trip to Manhattan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: then a great place to stay is this hotel. Not too big and impersonal just lovely friendly staff and well kitted out rooms.
reviews.title: want a hotel just off 5th avenue?
Nice room, Air Con Sucks!
reviews.text: I've stayed in a lot of hotels in NYK and this is great - I will be back!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: This hotel was in a great location (5 min walk from Empire State Building). The room we were staying in was small but clean and comfortable, The staff were very helpful, especially Millie who's enthusiastic recommendations on New York activities added a great deal to our holiday.
reviews.title: For a NY virgin, so pleased!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again on future trips. Its nothing fancy but it has everything that you need, the staff are very helpful also. The best thing about the hotel is the location, close to subway, shops, delis, laundry, and walking distance to Empire State Building, New York Public Library and Grand Central Station, and more. One problem only with hotel is there is no service elevator and rooms near the elevators are quite noisy as the elevators are very busy, so light sleepers should request a room away from elevators. Also I would advise people not to have breakfast at hotel, simply because there are several great delis within 1 block that do lovely inexpensive breakfast.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, everything one needs in NYC.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have just returned from New York and the Hotel Chandler and wholeheartedly recommend the Chandler. The location is fantastic, 5 minutes walk to the Empire State building and a little further for Macy's.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: The room was spotlessly clean and the housekeeping service was very good. Only complaint with the room was the shower seal - no matter how careful you were when showering we still ended up with a sopping wet bathroom floor.
reviews.title: Very pleasant place to stay at a central location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were excellent especvially the doormen and the free drinks/snacks service due to the renevations was excellent also.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the Chandler was an excellent base and I wouldn't hesitate on returning on a future trip to NY.
reviews.title: Nice, I would stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I checked in on September 4 and out on September 7.
reviews.title: OK with service issues
Nice Quiet Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: At the desk I requested a quiet room away from the elevators and not over the bar (I explained I was in town for business and quiet was key). Room 321 was a decent size for NY - I've stayed in larger, and I've stayed in smaller. It is really what you would expect for a NY hotel room. The room did not have an out facing window (looked over a dark alley - no sunlight), but I did ask for quiet and it certainly was. I should explain that I am from NY so basic street noise really does not bother me. I wanted to avoid neighboring room and bar noise and it was perfect for that.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here begins the problem. As the room was a bit stuffy I asked for a fan. The woman at the front desk, Tina, told me that the hotel does not have fans. When I told her I knew a previous guest of the hotel that had one, she told me should would check into it and call me. Of course, there was never a follow-up call.
reviews.title: London Lady

likes.liked: — The Staff, location and the quality of accomdation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While unpacking, I decided to iron a few things. After a few minutes, the smoke detector went off and I could not get it to stop. I called the front desk and Tina said she would send maintenance up. The maintenance person came up (the detector had stopped at that point), and he thought he should change the battery regardless. I asked about the fan again and he told me to put on the AC and that he would check on the fan - that never happened either.
reviews.title: hated it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Soon after the main. man left, the detector started beeping very loudly every sixty seconds (as it does when a battery needs to be replaced). I called down again, explained the situation, and the main. man came back up. He told me that the room was too hot and that I should leave the door open and let the ac kick in. I explained that it seemed like an old battery issue - he said no, it could not be. His other option was to take the detector out entirely and I told him that the NY Fire Department would not be very happy about that (and neither would I).
reviews.title: Great Location.....Nice Rooms....But Noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: At first a bit worried since we, nor a lot of people that we know, never heard of Hotel Chandler, once we arrived we were more than satisfied. Everything from decor, ambience, the staff and the cleanliness of the lobby and rooms were top notch. Being that we were two friends looking for a great vacation in NYC, Hotel Chandler was the best hotel we could have stayed at. The staff, especially the bell staff and housekeepers, exceeded our expectations. We will definitley stay here again and hope that many others will as well.
reviews.title: Could not have been happier!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel after reviewing all the helpful reviews and for the location. This hotel is 4 blocks up from Madison Square Garden. It is 2 blocks from the Empire State Building. I don't know why people are complaining about it being out of the way-this is New York-you are supposed to be walking places to absorb the city! We walked from Penn Station to the hotel and checked in to an adorable queen bed room at the end of the hallway so only 1 neighbor but it didn't matter because we didn't hear anything outside our room. The room had black out shades-WHICH WERE FABULOUS! There is a turn down service each night and the complimentary products are Aveda. The staff was wonderful and helpful and there is free on site internet and a hotel computer to use. Overall we would definitely stay here again. We loved the location and had a great time. The hotel offers complimentary tea and coffee and apples in the back bar area all day and the bell staff is phenomenal!
reviews.title: Perfect Boutique Hotel!!!

likes.liked: — The location was fantastic for us!
likes.disliked: — Nothing was bad enough to remember.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Chandler is a nice, clean hotel with a very friendly staff. If you arrive early for check-in, you can have your luggage stored at no charge (which is rare in NYC). The free wireless internet is great. There is a turn-down service which includes shutting the blinds and shades. I have three complaints about the hotel. One, our mini fridge never got cold even though it was plugged in, so we were never able to have cold drinks and there is no ice machine in the hotel (which is a definite negative in the summer). The bathroom door could not close all the way (the door literally didn't fit into the frame). Most importantly, the hotel is a little out of the way. The only major attraction close to the hotel is the Empire State Building. So, as long as you are comfortable with taking the subway everywhere, you will be fine. The majority of the restauarants around the hotel serve sushi, Thai food, and curry. Overall, the hotel was a great experience, but I would have preferred to be in more of the heart of the action.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel...A Little Out of The Way
Better than Average!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Chandler for 4 nights. Our room was small, but nicely decorated with quality linens, thick towels, nice bathrobes, Aveda soaps, shampoo, conditioner. Good water pressure - liked the rain shower head. Only one small shelf in the bathroom which made it difficult to put out our toiletries. I have a hanging bag which came in handy at this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Large thin flat screen TV, AM/FM clock radio with docking station for IPOD. Desk & chair. 2 plush chairs & small round table. Large comfortable bed. Iron/ironing board. Hair dryer was in the closet. There was no room to put it down in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Fab Fab Fab

likes.liked: — Location, wet room and free tea!

description: Set close to the Empire State Building, Madison Square Park, Penn Station and Times Square this is a secret, elegant and classical gem: Hotel Chandler. Recent renewal and upgrading within the hotel adds new sparkle, yet, the Chandler provides a timeless sense of luxury in its architecture, the original 1907 structure. Every guest is shown an intimate and personalized style of service, with quiet concern and pride. Located on 31st Street between Madison and Fifth Avenues, all of New York City is easily accessible to all citywide transportation and as the heart of amazing city walks.
